unnormalised: **Automotive News: Kitna Deti Hai? Fuel Efficiency Still King in India!**
normalised: **Automotive News: How Much Does It Give? Fuel Efficiency Still King in India!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, petrol prices got you down? You’re not alone! Turns out, "kitna deti hai?" (how much mileage does it give?) is STILL the most important question for most Indian car buyers.
normalised: Hey folks, petrol prices got you down? You are not alone! Turns out, "how much mileage does it give?" is still the most important question for most Indian car buyers.

unnormalised: Forget fancy features, touchscreen infotainment, and ventilated seats – though those are nice too! According to a recent survey by IIM Bangalore, fuel efficiency ranks higher than all that, especially with rising fuel costs.
normalised: Forget fancy features, touchscreen infotainment, and ventilated seats – though those are nice too! According to a recent survey by I I M Bangalore, fuel efficiency ranks higher than all that, especially with rising fuel costs.

unnormalised: People are looking at CNG options, EVs, and even considering smaller, more fuel-sipping petrol cars again. Looks like the Maruti Suzuki Alto 800 isn't going anywhere soon!
normalised: People are looking at C N G options, E V's, and even considering smaller, more fuel-sipping petrol cars again. Looks like the Maruti Suzuki Alto eight hundred is not going anywhere soon!

unnormalised: Heard Ravi from Chennai managed a whopping 32 km/litre on his new WagonR. That's like driving from Chennai to Vellore on a tankful!
normalised: Heard Ravi from Chennai managed a whopping thirty two kilometer per litre on his new WagonR. That is like driving from Chennai to Vellore on a tankful!

unnormalised: And just in time for Onam, too! Think of all that extra sadhya you could buy with the savings!
normalised: And just in time for Onam, too! Think of all that extra sadhya you could buy with the savings!

unnormalised: Companies like Tata and Mahindra are also focusing on improving mileage in their existing models, and we might just see a new generation of super-efficient cars coming soon. After all, who doesn't want to save some Rs. when prices are so high?
normalised: Companies like Tata and Mahindra are also focusing on improving mileage in their existing models, and we might just see a new generation of super-efficient cars coming soon. After all, who does not want to save some rupees when prices are so high?

unnormalised: Maybe enough to treat yourself with an extra plate of biryani!
normalised: Maybe enough to treat yourself with an extra plate of biryani!
